title: Woman and daughter killed as car rams French farmers' roadblock
summary: Protesting farmers have been setting up blockades, mostly in southwestern France, to protest low food prices, higher fuel prices and environmental protection rules.

title: Turkey's parliament ratifies Sweden's NATO membership
summary: Turkey's approval vote on Tuesday leaves Viktor Orban's Hungary as the sole NATO country yet to approve Sweden's accession.

title: Trump-Haley duel takes hold in New Hampshire
summary: After Ron DeSantis pulled out at the eleventh hour, Nikki Haley is banking heavily on support from unaffiliated and independent voters in a race dominated by Donald Trump.

title: Alabama's planned nitrogen hypoxia execution raising controversy
summary: The Southern state, one of 10 American states along with the federal government still enforcing capital punishment, is preparing to use a new execution method on a man who was sentenced to death in 1988.

title: South Africa, diplomatic spearhead of the Global South
summary: Pretoria has found the opportunity to test international institutions by accusing Israel of genocide in Gaza before the International Court of Justice.

title: AFCON 2024: Algeria knocked out of tournament by Mauritania
summary: Mauritania, meanwhile, are now certain to advance to the knockout phase for the first time in their history. Angola, Gambia and Senegal also all won on Tuesday to advance to the next round.

title: Netflix gains 13 million new subscribers despite price hikes
summary: The streaming company announced on Tuesday that it finished 2023 with slightly more than 260 million subscribers worldwide despite having increased the price of its basic plan in the United States, Britain and France.

title: India plays a central role in unfolding Red Sea crisis
summary: The country, whose ships now have to sail around Africa to deliver goods to Europe, is suffering from rising transport costs and is worried about its energy security.

title: Ecuador's President Noboa adopts tough stance over surging gang violence
summary: In Guayaquil, the country's leading cocaine export port, locals are traumatized by the surge in violence triggered by the mutiny of criminal gangs in the country's prisons. They applaud the army's deployment.

title: Israel-Palestine: Europeans united to defend the idea of a two-state solution
summary: The 27 EU member states are still unable to agree on a unified call for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza, but they are unanimous on how to resolve the conflict.

title: AFCON 2024: Host Côte d'Ivoire on brink of nightmare elimination
summary: The AFCON hosts were thoroughly beaten in their final group match against Equatorial Guinea. They are now hoping for a miracle to qualify for the round of 16.

title: Oscars: 'Oppenheimer' tops nominations
summary: Christopher Nolan's biopic received 13 nominations, followed by Greta Gerwig's 'Barbie' with eight. French film 'Anatomy of a Fall' was nominated for best picture, directing, actress, original screenplay and editing.

title: New Hampshire holds unusual Democratic primary, without Biden on the ballot
summary: The Democratic Party leadership does not recognize the New England state poll, which refused to hold it later in the nomination race.

title: Paris Men's Fashion Week: When simplicity makes dreams come true
summary: From classic coats cut from sumptuous materials at Dior to chic suits embroidered with floral motifs at Kenzo, on the Paris catwalks, men's wardrobe basics are putting on a show.

title: World Bank approves $300 million in funding for Ghana
summary: The financing arrangement is the first of three $300 million loans designed to support Ghana's failing economy through a series of steps including strengthening domestic revenue mobilization and removing barriers to private sector investment.

title: Kenya death cult leader charged with manslaughter
summary: Paul Nthenge Mackenzie is alleged to have incited hundreds of his acolytes to starve to death in order to 'meet Jesus' in a case that shocked the world.

title: Rented out for the Olympics: 'She's planned to use the competition to pay for her new boiler'
summary: To escape the madness of the 2024 Olympics, these residents of northern Paris have decided to leave the capital and their homes this summer. And they intend to make a little profit out of it.

title: Images of farmers blocking French roads in protest of rising costs, excessive regulation
summary: Angered by rising taxes, environmental regulations and a lack of government subsidies, French farmers have been blocking freeways in protest.

title: Donald Trump wins New Hampshire Republican primary
summary: The former US president defeated Nikki Haley in the second Republican vote on Tuesday, increasing the chances of a November rematch with President Joe Biden.

title: Los Angeles Times lays off more than 115 journalists
summary: The US newspaper on Tuesday announced plans for one of its largest staff reductions in its 143-year history, with layoffs affecting over 20% of the newsroom.
